title: Man accidentally shot in foot on Cleveland's East Side
content:
(File photo)
CLEVELAND, Ohio - A man was shot Saturday evening, in what appears to be an accident, on the city's East Side, police said.
The shooting happened on the 2900 block of East 97th Street in Cleveland's Buckeye-Woodhill neighborhood, Cleveland police spokesman Det. Reginald Lanton said. The victim, a 20-year-old man, was struck in the foot by a bullet that was accidentally fired.
The man was taken to the Cleveland Clinic for treatment in a private car, Lanton said.
No additional details about the shooting were available Sunday morning.
If you'd like to comment on this post, please visit the cleveland.com crime and courts comments section.
